definition: (of a child) clingy/(of a pet) fond of interacting with people/friendly
sticky/glutinous/(Tw) to adhere/to stick on/to glue

sentences.english: On this little piggy happiness leaves its traces.
sentences.chinese: 黏人的小豬身上，留下快樂的印記。

sentences.english: I could tell that she was probably a very affectionate and dependent woman.
sentences.chinese: 知道她可能是一位很會撒嬌，很黏人的阿嬤。

sentences.english: Instead, owners believed the cats showed more affection.
sentences.chinese: 相反，貓奴相信貓表現更黏人。

sentences.english: Clingy kids are by nature a bit more timid and anxious.
sentences.chinese: 就黏人的孩子的本性而言，他們有點膽小和焦慮。
他不能忍受太黏人的情婦。

sentences.english: I got all needy ad clingy.
sentences.chinese: 我變得很空虛又很黏人。

definition: to adhere/to stick together/to bond/to agglutinate/adhesion/adhesive
sticky/glutinous/(Tw) to adhere/to stick on/to glue
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
fear of strangers/to be afraid of strangers (of small children)
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
home-loving/to feel a strong attachment to home life/to begrudge being away from home
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
